本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: an official post station, many of which were established in ritsuryô times along the seven circuit highways (shichidô). Such post stations were to be used by officials travelling to and from the capital—the stations provided horses and other needed provisions. [律令] [七道]
